description: Borrowed from Spanish caníbal, from Taíno caniba, the Taíno form recorded by Christopher Columbus for the Caribs, who were greatly feared. From an Arawakan language, probably Taíno. Displaced native Old English selfǣta (literally “self-eater”).

entries.meaning: An organism which eats others of its own species or kind, especially a human who eats human flesh.
examples: These insects were not uncommon beneath stones. I found one cannibal scorpion quietly devouring another.
